result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles J Redcloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Victim notification complied with.  Plead guilty to count 3 as charged in 15CM97.  Dismiss, but read in Counts 1 and 2.  Plead guilty to the sole count in 15CM98.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the charges he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Repeater allegation confirmed by the court.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea. Found guilty of Disorderly Conduct as a repeater in 15CM97 and Disorderly Conduct in 15CM98.  Joint recommendation for:  $75.00, plus costs in 15CM97.  Costs only on 15CM98.  Court ordered the same.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.  Apply bond on file to fine.  Pay @ $25/mo starting 7/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendat appears with counsel Danile Linehan.  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Both cases will be set for plea.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Minutes taken by G.J.:  Defendant appeared in custody in person from Jackson County Jail with counsel Daniel Linehan.  Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Attorney Linehan filed a Motion to Withdraw Counsel/Substitution for both 15CM97 & 15CM98.  Defendant states he didn't appear on 9-21-15 because he thought it was just his attorney that had to appear.  Attorney Linehan updates his client's address to:  8828 Thundercloud Rd., Black River Falls, WI.  ADA Inlow requests cases be set for pretrial 12-2-15 at 10:00 and status on 12-14-15 at 3:00.  ADA Inlow states she will leave the bond up to the Court.  Attorney Linehan states he has ties to the community and requests no cash.  Court orders $150 cash bond with same conditions covering both cases.

Covers 15CM97 & 15CM98:  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: Karyn Y. and Andrew H.. May have contact through Robin Luther with Karyn Y. for child placement only.

Pre-trial conference at 12-02-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 12-14-2015 03:00 pm.
